Close top ad Marine (Legacy of the Void) =========================== From Liquipedia StarCraft 2 Wiki _This article covers the current multiplayer version of this unit. For other versions see [Marine (Wings of Liberty and Heart of the Swarm)](/starcraft2/Marine_(Wings_of_Liberty_and_Heart_of_the_Swarm) "Marine (Wings of Liberty and Heart of the Swarm)") and [Marine (Wings of Liberty Campaign)](/starcraft2/Marine_(Wings_of_Liberty_Campaign) "Marine (Wings of Liberty Campaign)") ._ \[[e](https://liquipedia.net/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marine_%28Legacy_of_the_Void%29&action=edit§ion=0)\ \]\[[h](/starcraft2/Template:Infobox_unit "Template:Infobox unit")\ [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/d/d8/SC2Marine.jpg/600px-SC2Marine.jpg)](/starcraft2/File:SC2Marine.jpg) Unit Information Type: Small Ground Unit Description: General-purpose infantry Built From: [Barracks](/starcraft2/Barracks "Barracks") Cost: [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/a/a4/Minerals.gif)](/starcraft2/Minerals "Minerals") Speed")  18 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/b/ba/Supply-terran.gif)](/starcraft2/Supply "Supply")  1 [Hotkey](/starcraft2/Hotkeys_per_Race "Hotkeys per Race") : A Attack 1: C-14 Gauss Rifle Targets: Ground / Air Damage: 6 (+1) [DPS](/starcraft2/Damage_Per_Second "Damage Per Second") : 9.8 (+1.6) 14.7 (+2.4) ([Stimpack](/starcraft2/Stimpack "Stimpack") ) [Cooldown](/starcraft2/Cooldown "Cooldown") : 0.61 (-0.203) [Range](/starcraft2/Range "Range") : 5 Unit stats Defense: ![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/e/e2/Icon_Hitpoints.png) 45 (+10) [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/5/5e/Icon_Armor.png)](/starcraft2/Armor "Armor") 0 (+1) Attributes: [Biological](/starcraft2/Biological "Biological") , [Light](/starcraft2/Light "Light") Sight: 9 Speed: 3.15 (+1.57) Cargo size: 1 Strong against: * [Hydralisk](/starcraft2/Hydralisk "Hydralisk") * [Immortal](/starcraft2/Immortal "Immortal") * [Marauder](/starcraft2/Marauder "Marauder") Weak against: * [Baneling](/starcraft2/Baneling "Baneling") * [Colossus](/starcraft2/Colossus "Colossus") * [Siege Tank](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank "Siege Tank") Contents -------- * [1 Description](#Description) * [2 Abilities](#Abilities) * [3 Upgrades](#Upgrades) * [4 Competitive Usage](#Competitive_Usage) * [4.1 General](#General) * [4.2 Vs. Protoss](#Vs._Protoss) * [4.3 Vs. Terran](#Vs._Terran) * [4.4 Vs. Zerg](#Vs._Zerg) * [5 Combos](#Combos) * [6 Gallery](#Gallery) * [7 Quotes](#Quotes) * [8 Patch Changes](#Patch_Changes) * [9 References](#References) Description\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marine_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=1 "Edit section: Description")\ \] --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- **Marines** are the all-purpose infantry unit produced from a [Barracks](/starcraft2/Barracks "Barracks") . Having the quickest and cheapest production of all Terran units make the Mineral backbone that scales very well with [Stimpack](/starcraft2/Stimpack "Stimpack") , [Engineering Bay](/starcraft2/Engineering_Bay "Engineering Bay") upgrades and [Medivacs](/starcraft2/Medivac "Medivac") from the [Starport](/starcraft2/Starport "Starport") . Before Stimpack, Marines are less than effective against [Zerglings](/starcraft2/Zerglings "Zerglings") and [Zealots](/starcraft2/Zealots "Zealots") ; at least one [Bunker](/starcraft2/Bunker "Bunker") and [Supply Depots](/starcraft2/Supply_Depot "Supply Depot") to wall-off is recommended for the early game. However, Marines can take advantage of [kiting](/starcraft2/Kiting "Kiting") and [Stutter Stepping](/starcraft2/Stutter_Step "Stutter Step") from distance. In the Mid-Late Game, high health [Marauders](/starcraft2/Marauder "Marauder") or [Hellbats](/starcraft2/Hellbat "Hellbat") can be used to Tank damage for the lower health Marines. [Medivacs](/starcraft2/Medivac "Medivac") can also Load 8 Marines per ship to harass the opposing bases and use unpassable ground to retreat behind safely. Abilities\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marine_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=2 "Edit section: Abilities")\ \] ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [Stimpack](/starcraft2/Stimpack "Stimpack") can be researched from a [Tech Lab](/starcraft2/Tech_Lab "Tech Lab") connected to a [Barracks](/starcraft2/Barracks "Barracks") and can then be used on Marines and [Marauders](/starcraft2/Marauder "Marauder") , at the cost of 10hp and 20hp per stim. Note that using [Stimpack](/starcraft2/Stimpack "Stimpack") when it is already in effect does nothing but refresh the duration. [Stimpack](/starcraft2/Stimpack "Stimpack") | | | | --- | --- | | [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/3/39/Stimpack.png/62px-Stimpack.png)](/starcraft2/File:Stimpack.png) | **[Duration](/starcraft2/Game_Speed "Game Speed")
:** 11 s

**[Hotkey](/starcraft2/Hotkeys_per_Race "Hotkeys per Race")
:** T

Increases the movement speed and firing rate by 50% at the cost of 10 HP for a [Marine](/starcraft2/Marine "Marine")
or 20 HP for a [Marauder](/starcraft2/Marauder "Marauder")
. | Upgrades\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marine_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=3 "Edit section: Upgrades")\ \] --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- These upgrades are researched at the Barracks' [Tech Lab](/starcraft2/Tech_Lab "Tech Lab") . [Stimpack](/starcraft2/Stimpack "Stimpack") | | | | --- | --- | | [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/3/39/Stimpack.png/62px-Stimpack.png)](/starcraft2/File:Stimpack.png) | **[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/a/a4/Minerals.gif)](/starcraft2/Minerals "Minerals")
** 100

** 100

:** T

**Researched from:** [Tech Lab](/starcraft2/Tech_Lab#Barracks "Tech Lab")

Every [Marine](/starcraft2/Marine "Marine")
and [Marauder](/starcraft2/Marauder "Marauder")
gain the **Stimpack** ability. | [Combat Shield](/starcraft2/Combat_Shield "Combat Shield") | | | | --- | --- | | [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/8/81/Combat_Shield.png/60px-Combat_Shield.png)](/starcraft2/File:Combat_Shield.png) | **[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/a/a4/Minerals.gif)](/starcraft2/Minerals "Minerals")
** 100

:** C

**Researched from:** [Tech Lab](/starcraft2/Tech_Lab#Barracks "Tech Lab")

Every [Marine](/starcraft2/Marine "Marine")
gains a **Combat Shield** that gives 10 hitpoints. | Competitive Usage\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marine_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=4 "Edit section: Competitive Usage")\ \] --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ### General\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marine_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=5 "Edit section: General")\ \] * Can be used for a fast two base timing with the first 2 [Medivacs](/starcraft2/Medivac "Medivac") and [Stimpack](/starcraft2/Stimpack "Stimpack") (usually timed to finish together) for harassing or early pressure with a quick retreat. * Can be combined with the firepower of [Siege Tanks](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank "Siege Tank") or [Widow Mines](/starcraft2/Widow_Mine "Widow Mine") and lose some mobility for more firepower. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/e/e4/ProtossIcon.png/30px-ProtossIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ProtossIcon.png) Protoss\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marine_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=6 "Edit section: Vs. Protoss")\ \] * Marines have massive swings in army value, due to how much better they get once stim is done and how much worse they get when [Colossi](/starcraft2/Colossus "Colossus") or [High Templars](/starcraft2/High_Templars "High Templars") are out for the Protoss. * The Sentry's [Guardian Shield](/starcraft2/Guardian_Shield "Guardian Shield") effectively cuts the damage done by the marine by 1/3. * Caution must be exercised with Marines and and [Widow Mines](/starcraft2/Widow_Mines "Widow Mines") when around Colossi and High Templars with their area effect damage. Colossi are hard countered by [Vikings](/starcraft2/Viking "Viking") , while High Templar have a weird "counters each other thing" going on with [Ghosts](/starcraft2/Ghost "Ghost") and [EMP Round](/starcraft2/EMP_Round "EMP Round") ability. Marines gain an additional role once [Medivacs](/starcraft2/Medivac "Medivac") are added to the Terran army. Protoss units generally benefit from being near each other and supporting each other, leading to a [Death Ball](/starcraft2/Definitions#D "Definitions") style of play. By loading small groups of Marines into Medivacs, you can stop Protoss from taking riskier and distance mining bases too far out the way for a ground army to defend effectively. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/9/94/TerranIcon.png/30px-TerranIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:TerranIcon.png) Terran\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marine_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=7 "Edit section: Vs. Terran")\ \] * [Combat Shielded](/starcraft2/Combat_Shields "Combat Shields") Marines will survive a fight with a Stimpack-upgraded Marine with 7 HP. Combat Shield also takes less time to research, so in early Marine vs Marine skirmishes, one should not necessarily get the Stimpack upgrade first by default in TvT. * Against [Banshees](/starcraft2/Banshee "Banshee") it is recommended to get at least one [Viking](/starcraft2/Viking "Viking") or [Cyclone](/starcraft2/Cyclone "Cyclone") , as marines can lack the range and speed to finish off a banshee fleeing from a scan. * Against [Battlecruisers](/starcraft2/Battlecruiser "Battlecruiser") if there are more air armor upgrades than bio attack upgrades, the DPS of the Marines is cut down by a third so it is important to keep upgrading. [Ravens](/starcraft2/Raven "Raven") or [Vikings](/starcraft2/Viking "Viking") are recommended to stop them from teleporting or to kill them. * In most TvT matches, the early and mid game involves trying to force your opponent to unsiege the tanks so that agile-yet-fragile marines can stim in without dying. * A [Sieged Tank](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank "Siege Tank") does 40 (+4) damage to marines, so with 0/0 and stimmed marines, the tank will one shot them, but two shot them if the marines have CS or aren't stimmed. However, they can kill marines that have CS and have been stimmed in a single shot, if both sides have 3/3 and the marine isn't healed by a medivac. Due to splash damage it will kill 3-6 marines in total if marines are clumped up. * If there is a lump of sieged tanks with no supporting units, medivacs can drop marines in-between the tanks, causing them to kill each other through friendly fire. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/d/d1/ZergIcon.png/30px-ZergIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ZergIcon.png) Zerg\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marine_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=8 "Edit section: Vs. Zerg")\ \] Marines are often the core component of a TvZ army, due to their cheapness and high DPS. * [Siege Tanks](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank "Siege Tank") and [Widow Mines](/starcraft2/Widow_Mines "Widow Mines") are needed to accompany the marines to thwart [Banelings](/starcraft2/Baneling "Baneling") once Centrifugal Hooks is done. * If one loses their Marines, [Mutalisks](/starcraft2/Mutalisk "Mutalisk") will reign superior and either kill all your units and end the game, or contain you and gain superior map control. Once upgrades and [Medivacs](/starcraft2/Medivac "Medivac") come into play, Marines will be very effective against [Zerglings](/starcraft2/Zergling "Zergling") and [Mutalisks](/starcraft2/Mutalisk "Mutalisk") , therefore requiring the Zerg to increase the [Baneling](/starcraft2/Baneling "Baneling") count. * [Lurkers](/starcraft2/Lurker "Lurker") are quite strong against marines, so [Marauders](/starcraft2/Marauder "Marauder") or extra Tanks are used to help out. [Ghosts](/starcraft2/Ghost "Ghost") or [Liberators](/starcraft2/Liberator "Liberator") can counter them more effectively, however. * Marines barely scratch [Ultralisks](/starcraft2/Ultralisk "Ultralisk") once Chitinous Plating is done, so Marauders, Ghosts, or Liberators are important. * [Fungal Growth](/starcraft2/Fungal_Growth "Fungal Growth") will quickly kill marines, so watch out for that. Ghosts can EMP the [Infestors](/starcraft2/Infestor "Infestor") out of the fight, while Tanks will out range them if spotted. Combos\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marine_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=9 "Edit section: Combos")\ \] ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Marines are good with: * [Marauders](/starcraft2/Marauder "Marauder") and [Medivacs](/starcraft2/Medivac "Medivac") for anti-air and increased dps * [Siege Tanks](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank "Siege Tank") for anti-air * [Battlecruisers](/starcraft2/Battlecruiser "Battlecruiser") for increased dps and to support against [Void Rays](/starcraft2/Void_Ray "Void Ray") and [Corruptors](/starcraft2/Corruptor "Corruptor") * [Ravens](/starcraft2/Raven "Raven") for a mineral sink in mass Raven builds Gallery\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marine_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=10 "Edit section: Gallery")\ \] -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/0/05/Marine.gif)](/starcraft2/File:Marine.gif) Quotes\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Marine_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=11 "Edit section: Quotes")\ \] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | \[[hide](#)

html:
Marine (Legacy of the Void)

From Liquipedia StarCraft 2 Wiki


This article covers the current multiplayer version of this unit. For other versions see Marine (Wings of Liberty and Heart of the Swarm) and Marine (Wings of Liberty Campaign).
[e][h] Marine
Unit Information
Type:
Small Ground Unit
Description:
General-purpose infantry
Built From:
Barracks
Cost:
 50  0  18  1
Hotkey:
A
Attack 1: C-14 Gauss Rifle
Targets:
Ground / Air
Damage:
6 (+1)
DPS:
9.8 (+1.6)
14.7 (+2.4) (Stimpack)
Cooldown:
0.61 (-0.203)
Range:
5
Unit stats
Defense:
45 (+10) 0 (+1)
Attributes:
Biological, Light
Sight:
9
Speed:
3.15 (+1.57)
Cargo size:
1
Strong against:
  • Hydralisk
  • Immortal
  • Marauder
Weak against:
  • Baneling
  • Colossus
  • Siege Tank

Contents

  • 1 Description
  • 2 Abilities
  • 3 Upgrades
  • 4 Competitive Usage
    • 4.1 General
    • 4.2 Vs. Protoss
    • 4.3 Vs. Terran
    • 4.4 Vs. Zerg
  • 5 Combos
  • 6 Gallery
  • 7 Quotes
  • 8 Patch Changes
  • 9 References

Description[edit]

Marines are the all-purpose infantry unit produced from a Barracks. Having the quickest and cheapest production of all Terran units make the Mineral backbone that scales very well with Stimpack, Engineering Bay upgrades and Medivacs from the Starport. Before Stimpack, Marines are less than effective against Zerglings and Zealots; at least one Bunker and Supply Depots to wall-off is recommended for the early game.

However, Marines can take advantage of kiting and Stutter Stepping from distance. In the Mid-Late Game, high health Marauders or Hellbats can be used to Tank damage for the lower health Marines. Medivacs can also Load 8 Marines per ship to harass the opposing bases and use unpassable ground to retreat behind safely.

Abilities[edit]

Stimpack can be researched from a Tech Lab connected to a Barracks and can then be used on Marines and Marauders, at the cost of 10hp and 20hp per stim. Note that using Stimpack when it is already in effect does nothing but refresh the duration.

Stimpack
Duration: 11 s
Hotkey: T
Increases the movement speed and firing rate by 50% at the cost of 10 HP for a Marine or 20 HP for a Marauder.

Upgrades[edit]

These upgrades are researched at the Barracks' Tech Lab.

Stimpack
100
100
100
Hotkey: T
Researched from: Tech Lab
Every Marine and Marauder gain the Stimpack ability.
Combat Shield
100
100
79
Hotkey: C
Researched from: Tech Lab
Every Marine gains a Combat Shield that gives 10 hitpoints.

Competitive Usage[edit]

General[edit]

  • Can be used for a fast two base timing with the first 2 Medivacs and Stimpack (usually timed to finish together) for harassing or early pressure with a quick retreat.
  • Can be combined with the firepower of Siege Tanks or Widow Mines and lose some mobility for more firepower.

Vs. Protoss[edit]

  • Marines have massive swings in army value, due to how much better they get once stim is done and how much worse they get when Colossi or High Templars are out for the Protoss.
  • The Sentry's Guardian Shield effectively cuts the damage done by the marine by 1/3.
  • Caution must be exercised with Marines and and Widow Mines when around Colossi and High Templars with their area effect damage. Colossi are hard countered by Vikings, while High Templar have a weird "counters each other thing" going on with Ghosts and EMP Round ability.

Marines gain an additional role once Medivacs are added to the Terran army. Protoss units generally benefit from being near each other and supporting each other, leading to a Death Ball style of play. By loading small groups of Marines into Medivacs, you can stop Protoss from taking riskier and distance mining bases too far out the way for a ground army to defend effectively.

Vs. Terran[edit]

  • Combat Shielded Marines will survive a fight with a Stimpack-upgraded Marine with 7 HP. Combat Shield also takes less time to research, so in early Marine vs Marine skirmishes, one should not necessarily get the Stimpack upgrade first by default in TvT.
  • Against Banshees it is recommended to get at least one Viking or Cyclone, as marines can lack the range and speed to finish off a banshee fleeing from a scan.
  • Against Battlecruisers if there are more air armor upgrades than bio attack upgrades, the DPS of the Marines is cut down by a third so it is important to keep upgrading. Ravens or Vikings are recommended to stop them from teleporting or to kill them.
  • In most TvT matches, the early and mid game involves trying to force your opponent to unsiege the tanks so that agile-yet-fragile marines can stim in without dying.
    • A Sieged Tank does 40 (+4) damage to marines, so with 0/0 and stimmed marines, the tank will one shot them, but two shot them if the marines have CS or aren't stimmed. However, they can kill marines that have CS and have been stimmed in a single shot, if both sides have 3/3 and the marine isn't healed by a medivac. Due to splash damage it will kill 3-6 marines in total if marines are clumped up.
    • If there is a lump of sieged tanks with no supporting units, medivacs can drop marines in-between the tanks, causing them to kill each other through friendly fire.

Vs. Zerg[edit]

Marines are often the core component of a TvZ army, due to their cheapness and high DPS.

  • Siege Tanks and Widow Mines are needed to accompany the marines to thwart Banelings once Centrifugal Hooks is done.
  • If one loses their Marines, Mutalisks will reign superior and either kill all your units and end the game, or contain you and gain superior map control. Once upgrades and Medivacs come into play, Marines will be very effective against Zerglings and Mutalisks, therefore requiring the Zerg to increase the Baneling count.
  • Lurkers are quite strong against marines, so Marauders or extra Tanks are used to help out. Ghosts or Liberators can counter them more effectively, however.
  • Marines barely scratch Ultralisks once Chitinous Plating is done, so Marauders, Ghosts, or Liberators are important.
  • Fungal Growth will quickly kill marines, so watch out for that. Ghosts can EMP the Infestors out of the fight, while Tanks will out range them if spotted.

Combos[edit]

Marines are good with:

  • Marauders and Medivacs for anti-air and increased dps
  • Siege Tanks for anti-air
  • Battlecruisers for increased dps and to support against Void Rays and Corruptors
  • Ravens for a mineral sink in mass Raven builds

Gallery[edit]

Quotes[edit]

[hide][show]Quotes
Built Selected Annoyed Move Attack Under Attack
  • Make way, comin' through.
  • You want a piece of me, boy?
  • Been waitin' on you.
  • You gonna give me orders?
  • Who wants some?[q 1]
  • This better be good.
  • By the numbers boys.
  • Armed and ready!
  • Man, still stuck in this chickensh*t outfit... [q 2]
  • How do you take a leak in this damn thing?!
  • Whatever I do, they keep bringing me back in!
  • This is my C14-Impaler Gauss Rifle, there are many like it but this one is mine.[q 3]
  • You ever notice how nobody ever comes back to the barracks?
  • I came here to kick ass and chew bubblegum... and I'm all out of- ah forget it. [q 4]
  • The only thing you should feel when you shoot somebody is the recoil.
  • Sure!
  • You got it.
  • Gangway, coming through.
  • Got it.
  • Go! Go! Go!
  • Yes, sir!
  • Roger that.
  • Orders received.
  • That's fine.
  • Affirmative.
  • 10-4!
  • Aye, aye.
  • Keep your shirt on, Sparky.
  • Lookin' forward to it.
  • Outstanding!
  • Why not?
  • Gonna get me some.
  • Booyah!
  • Hit it!
  • Get some!
  • Aaah!
  • Die! Die! Die!
  • Bring it!
  • Let's rock!
  • How's that for whoop-ass?
  • We could use some help here!
  • Mother? (Death)
  1. ↑ possible reference to Duke Nukem 3D
  2. ↑ reference to StarCraft referencing Aliens
  3. ↑ reference to the Rifleman's Creed
  4. ↑ from They Live.

Marine's quotes (video and sound) - YouTube video.

Patch Changes[edit]

No patch changes so far in LotV.
